reason: Self-reference package, no actual license restrictions
MIT-0 is a permissive OSS license (also known as 0BSD), functionally equivalent to MIT; maintained by well-known CSS Tools organization
MIT-0 is a permissive OSS license (also known as 0BSD), functionally equivalent to MIT; part of CSS Tools organization
Python-2.0 license is permissive and widely used; Python Software Foundation license allows commercial use and distribution. Acknowledged for common usage in npm ecosystem
CC-BY-4.0 is a Creative Commons license allowing commercial use with attribution; data package used by millions; attribution available in repo
Blue Oak Model License 1.0.0 is a permissive open-source license; approved by Fedora and used widely in npm ecosystem (9M+ weekly downloads); provides all permissions while protecting contributors

CC-BY-3.0 is a Creative Commons license; covers SPDX exception identifiers which are metadata, not code; attribution provided; widely accepted in npm ecosystem
MPL-2.0 is a permissive OSS license
